content.description:
Start on crimps on face, move right to good sidepull, then bump up through right hand sidepulls to the top of the boulder.

Can start on underling feature to add a few grades of difficulty
content.protection: Pad or two, two boulders at the base but unlikely to fall on them
content.location: Faces down hill, walk straight up from surgery and you should see it ( or parallel to the road in line with manchild boulder)

content.description: Start down and to the left on two underclings. Smear feet and power through an undercling sequence out right to a large sidepull jug. Recharge for a moment then reach out through slopey, blocky rails and oppose your body tension until ready to dunk the blind jug. Try not to end up in the bush!
content.protection: Multiple pads and spotters recommended. The landing is comprised of multiple jagged rocks.
content.location: This problem follows the blocky features up the south side of the ER boulder.

content.description:
Boulder starts seated on obvious pointed ledge, make tough moves up the arete until you can bust out right to a good sidepull

Then continue working your way up the arete
content.protection: Pads, spotter would be nice landing is a jumble of boulders
content.location: On the Austrian boulder, visible from the road ( you can see the changed up holds off the Austrian as you drive by) this problem is on the far left side of the boulder if facing

content.description: Definitely a Swan Falls classic! Sit start in the diagonal crack. Big move up and right to a nice crimp, get a right toe jam in the crack and swing out left to a side-pull sloper, then continue compressing upwards until you can mantle on slopey but decent holds.
content.location: From the Surgery boulder continue past slightly past the "Manchild Boulder". Look for a overhanging start with lots of big slopers up top.

content.description: Start on obvious chalked ledge go right and up, going left is harder with a much worse landing and probably more classic
content.protection: Pad, landing is chill on this one, going left would require much more
content.location: Just behind bear hug boulder, if coming from that direction it's impossible to miss.

content.description: Crux is pulling off the ground, pretty chill after opening move. Start seated on sidepull seam move up for a move or two to jugs and an easy top out
content.protection: Dab pad and some scrunchy skills
content.location: Just uphill from the Austrian boulder, you can see this climb of you are standing near Rex Kwan do

content.description: Begin as for California Love, but instead of moving up and left, move up and right past a V-shaped double crimp. Fun stuff!
content.protection: 4 or 5 pads, as the boulder traverses quite a bit.

content.description: Start on opposing side pulls and climb straight up through crimps to a semi-engaging top-out that ends in jugs.
content.location: Straight up the middle of the Flaky boulder.

content.description: Pull on a high crimp and sidepull. Climb up until reaching back around the blunt arete for a slopey jug to top out.
content.location: Farthest left on the Flaky boulder. Climb up the face and blunt arete.

content.description: Begin on a triangle shaped start hold and make your way up past a slanting seam to a shallow slot. From here make a long move to a crimp and top out. Â Book has V3/4 but seems pretty hard for that. I gave it solid V4 on here.
content.location: The center/right side of the main face of the flaky boulder.

content.description: Starts on giant jug sidepull up and left though crimps.
content.protection: Pads and spotter, kind of a jumble below a tall (for the area problem)
content.location: Visible from the road on the left face from the Austrian arete

content.description: Start matched on the obvious good hold in the middle of the face. Edge up the slab through shallow dishes while making use of similar holds for your feet.
content.location: Straight up the middle of the egg-shaped slab boulder behind and to the left of the Flaky boulder.

content.description: Start sitting on a pinch and edge and work up straight through the block (loose) through a large side-pull and establish on top of the boulder.
Same as The Austrian (V6) except begin as a sit start.
Sit Start on a large undercling flake and ascend the arete to the top.
content.location: The Austrian boulder just past the Black Slabbath boulder heading away from the parking lot and the Flaky boulder
